meanings.definition: A strip of material designed to be torn off easily, typically used for opening packaging.
meanings.sent1: I pulled the tearstrip on the package to open it.
meanings.sent2: The tearstrip on the bag made it easy to access the contents.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the tearstrip was a fun toy to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a tearstrip, easily unraveling with each new surprise.
meanings.sent5: The bright red tearstrip stood out against the dull packaging.

meanings.definition: To tear or rip along a designated strip or line.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tearstripped the paper along the dotted line.
meanings.sent2: The children tearstripped the wrapping paper in excitement.
meanings.sent3: He tearstripped the fabric to create a jagged edge for his art project.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to tearstrip the roof off the house.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the tearing tearstrip echoed through the room.
